name: Adrenaline Shots
window: After you exhaust 1 of your agents
text: Ready that agent or unlock your commander.
flavorText: Suffi was exhausted from the haul. After months of casing trade vessels, she had finally found what those pesky Tribesmen had paid so handsomely for. One of her crew handed her a vial from the thousands that had been stashed away inconspicuously. Without hesitation, she drank deeply from it.

name: Anti-Gravity Drive
window: After you activate a system
text: Choose 1 system that does not contain planets or anomalies. During this tactical action, you treat that system as if it contains each non-delta wormhole; you may also treat it as if it contains a gravity rift.
flavorText: Rin had received multiple warnings to avoid working with the Cabal. However, existential threats to the galaxy had never done much to quell her curiosity.

name: Artifact Hunters
window: Action
text: Explore 1 planet you control; if you draw a relic fragment, you may exhaust that planet and purge that fragment to gain 1 relic.
flavorText: "This is…" Dart let out a long whistle. "I can't identify a single part of it. Can you?"

name: Artifact Hunters
window: Action
text: Explore 1 planet you control; if you draw a relic fragment, you may exhaust that planet and purge that fragment to gain 1 relic.
flavorText: "This is…" Dart let out a long whistle. "I can't identify a single part of it. Can you?"

name: Artifact Hunters
window: Action
text: Explore 1 planet you control; if you draw a relic fragment, you may exhaust that planet and purge that fragment to gain 1 relic.
flavorText: "This is…" Dart let out a long whistle. "I can't identify a single part of it. Can you?"

name: Artifact Research
window: When you spend resources to research
text: For each relic fragment in your and your neighbors' play areas, reduce the resources spent by 1. Then, you may discard 2 of your relic fragments to research 1 additional technology.
flavorText: The observation team had protested with one voice, threatening to report to their respective governments and return with fleets should the Creuss continue to bar them from this discovery.

name: Assassination Attempt
window: Action
text: Choose 1 player and spend up to 3 trade goods. That player must exhaust their agent. Then, for each trade good you spent, they must discard 1 action card.
flavorText: Secret agent waiting, patient, forward deployed to a deep space station, cloaked up with transparasteel plating.

name: Brutal Occupation
window: After you gain control of a planet
text: Ready that planet and gain 2 commodities.
flavorText: Cabal cultists were known to quell threats of rebellion with stories of their penal colonies on the other side of the rift.

name: Corporate Lobbying
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player who voted for or predicted the resolved outcome gains 2 trade goods.
flavorText: As he signed the last of the costly trade deals, Mot Nesretep sank back into his chair. It was a gamble with the fate of the galaxy at stake, but his empire was secure. Many would suffer, but that was a sacrifice he was willing to make.

name: Counter-intelligence
window: Action
text: Remove 1 token from another player's strategy pool and return it to their reinforcements.
flavorText: The leaked documents brought a smile to Willard's face. Schemes upon schemes, none of which would ever reach fruition.

name: Derelict Space Station
window: Action
text: Choose 1 system that contains your ships and does not contain any planets. If that system does not already have a frontier token, place 1 frontier token in it. Then, explore the frontier token in that system.
flavorText: The inhabitants of this forlorn place had long forgotten civilization. Their caches, however, bespoke what they once were.

name: Derelict Space Station
window: Action
text: Choose 1 system that contains your ships and does not contain any planets. If that system does not already have a frontier token, place 1 frontier token in it. Then, explore the frontier token in that system.
flavorText: The inhabitants of this forlorn place had long forgotten civilization. Their caches, however, bespoke what they once were.

name: Derelict Space Station
window: Action
text: Choose 1 system that contains your ships and does not contain any planets. If that system does not already have a frontier token, place 1 frontier token in it. Then, explore the frontier token in that system.
flavorText: The inhabitants of this forlorn place had long forgotten civilization. Their caches, however, bespoke what they once were.

name: Fire for Effect
window: At the end of a round of space combat
text: Your units in the active system use their SPACE CANNON abilities against your opponent's ships.
flavorText: Trrakan had stockpiled munitions for this moment. If the reports were correct, and their forces were able to stave off the invasion for long enough, the enemy would find themselves under near continuous fire.

name: Overtime
window: Action
text: Spend between 1 and 3 trade goods to ready an equal number of planets you control.
flavorText: The factories reopened without resistance in the end. Was it the generous payments or the Letnev gunships overhead?

name: Propaganda
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Exhaust up to 2 of your non-home planets other than Mecatol Rex. Then, place a number of infantry on each of those planets equal to their influence value.
flavorText: Sara, Blake, and Nolad stepped in front of the camera with a salute as Jace spoke, "They're doing their part. Are you? Join the Mobile Infantry and save the universe. Service guarantees citizenship."

name: Prophecy
window: After a die is rolled
text: Apply +3 or -3 to the result of that roll.
flavorText: "Well, I don't feel any different," Dart said, his eyes blazing with the fire of a thousand dying worlds. "What do you mean 'oh god your eyes'?"

name: Proxy War
window: Before you activate a system
text: During this tactical action, you do not count as having activated a system containing another player's units for the purpose of promissory note ability timings.
flavorText: The sensors of the lead ship exploded with an array of alarms and damage alerts as an entire fleet of unmarked ships poured forth from the wormhole, raining destruction upon the unsuspecting convoy. Reports be damned, these were no mere pirates.

name: Public Outcry
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: During this agenda, players cannot abstain if they are able to cast votes. If you did not cast votes for the resolved outcome of this agenda, each player who did must discard 1 action card.
flavorText: The public was split, and equally outraged. This was a game of cutting one's losses.

name: Rapid Mobilization
window: Action
text: Choose 1 of your units with PRODUCTION; use that units PRODUCTION ability, producing only infantry or fighters.
flavorText: Dannel smiled softly. A rare occurrence these days, to be sure. "Glory to the Yin, my brothers. You have done us all proud."

name: Reconstruction
window: Action
text: Ready 1 planet you control. Then, reveal the top 3 cards of the exploration deck that matches that planet; attach each attachment that you reveal to that planet and discard the rest.
flavorText: The world was far from its former glory, but with proper care, it would become a paradise once more.

name: Relay Connection
window: Action
text: Choose 1 ship type. You may produce 1 ship of that type in each system that contains 1 of your space docks.
flavorText: His engineers broke into celebration as Umbat called out to praise them, "The forge burns, my soul alight! This is our freedom!"

name: Shrapnel Turrets
window: Before you roll dice for ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE
text: Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that do not have ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE gain ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE 9(x2) until the end of the combat.
flavorText: Mendosa grinned widely. "Ye say we're out of munitions, yet look at all this junk lyin' around. Get it movin' fast enough, and it'll shred them up just fine."

name: Steal Prototype
window: After you destroy another player's unit
text: If that player owns the unit upgrade technology for that unit, spend 4 resources to gain that unit upgrade technology.
flavorText: The reengineering efforts were surprising. Many of the Hylar ship's advancements could be retrofitted with ease.

name: Steal Prototype
window: After you destroy another player's unit
text: If that player owns the unit upgrade technology for that unit, spend 4 resources to gain that unit upgrade technology.
flavorText: The reengineering efforts were surprising. Many of the Hylar ship's advancements could be retrofitted with ease.

name: Steal Prototype
window: After you destroy another player's unit
text: If that player owns the unit upgrade technology for that unit, spend 4 resources to gain that unit upgrade technology.
flavorText: The reengineering efforts were surprising. Many of the Hylar ship's advancements could be retrofitted with ease.

name: Timely Reinforcements
window: At the start of the second round of a space combat
text: Place 2 fighters from your reinforcements into the active system.
flavorText: Most researchers question how the Naalu's prescience had not led them down a path of debilitating caution. The answer seems to lie in their excessive confidence.

name: Timely Reinforcements
window: At the start of the second round of a space combat
text: Place 2 fighters from your reinforcements into the active system.
flavorText: Most researchers question how the Naalu's prescience had not led them down a path of debilitating caution. The answer seems to lie in their excessive confidence.

name: Timely Reinforcements
window: At the start of the second round of a space combat
text: Place 2 fighters from your reinforcements into the active system.
flavorText: Most researchers question how the Naalu's prescience had not led them down a path of debilitating caution. The answer seems to lie in their excessive confidence.

name: Rapid Mobilization
window: Action
text: Place 3 fighters from your reinforcements in each system that contains 1 of your space docks that is not blockaded.
flavorText: Dannel smiled softly. A rare occurrence these days, to be sure. "Glory to the Yin, my brothers. You have done us all proud."

name: Disrupted Logistics
window: After another player activates a system that contains your units
text: During this tactical action, the maximum number of non-fighter ships that player can have in the active system is reduced by 1.
flavorText: Communications were jammed. Supply lines were harried. Staffing officers were found dead in their bunks. The grandeur of the scheme shocked the admiral to his core.

name: Commercial Applications
window: Action
text: Gain trade goods equal to the resource or influence value of 1 of your planets that has a technology specialty.
flavorText: Another jolt from the machine surged through Rin's limbs. It no longer bothered her. She was changing. Not just mentally, but physically as well.

name: Anti-Gravity Drive
window: After you activate a system
text: Choose 1 system that does not contain planets or anomalies. During this tactical action, you treat that system as if it contains each non-delta wormhole; you may also treat it as if it contains a gravity rift.
flavorText: Rin had received multiple warnings to avoid working with the Cabal. However, existential threats to the galaxy had never done much to quell her curiosity.

name: Masterclass Logistics
window: After you activate a system
text: Move any number of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's units.
flavorText: This was the last mission of the Admiral's long, decorated career. When he was asked to oversee the feat, he refused, breaking into such a rage that he threw the papers, along with the man who brought them, out of his office. Five sleepless days later, planning was complete.

name: Deflection Tactics
window: At the start of the strategy phase
text: Choose 1 strategy card. Other players must spend 1 strategy token and 3 resources to choose that strategy card during this strategy phase, if they have another choice.
flavorText: The Tribe elder's eyes flickered in the light of the campfire. "The greatest form of persuasion lies in coercing another to believe the course of action you wish for them to take was their idea all along."

name: Psychological Operations
window: When you perform a strategic action
text: Choose 1 player. When that player spends a command token during this strategic action, they must spend 1 additional command token from their strategy pool, if able.
flavorText: Spittle flew forth from The Stillness of Stars' crimson maw as a gurgled laugh escaped him. Panic filled the Federation airwaves. His human minions had done well.

name: Stolen Prototype
window: After you destroy 1 of another player's units
text: Spend 4 resources to research a unit upgrade technology of that unit's type; ignore 1 of that technology's prerequisites.
flavorText: Ssruu looked back from the pod as the infiltration team escaped the fiery inferno. Only as they cleared the blast radius did he loosen his grasp on the stolen plans.

name: Risky Jump
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +2 to the move value of 1 of your ships during this tactical action. When that ship moves into the active system, roll 1 die; on a result of 1-2, remove that ship from the game board, along with any units it is transporting.
flavorText: They were alive and ahead of schedule, but the captain had no intention of allowing the pilot to "eyeball it" ever again.

name: Dangerous Conditions
window: After another player activates a system
text: Choose 1 non-home anomaly. For each ship that moves out of, into, or through that system during this tactical action, roll 1 die; on a result of 1-3, remove that ship from the game board, along with any units it is transporting.
flavorText: "Even those who tread lightly through the void are often lost," Acamar said coldly. "Seal their fates, so others may be warned."

name: Bureaucracy Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, either draw 2 secret objectives or gain the speaker token.
flavorText: Today's session would be pivotal - the Keleres proclamation was to be signed into full effect. Qanoj smiled. A new chapter in his career would begin today.

name: Strategic Withdrawal
window: After you move ships into a system other than the active system
text: Remove any of your command tokens from that system. [Note: 'Into' specifically refers to a destination system, not systems you move 'through'.]
flavorText: The skirmish was merely a ploy to draw them out. The Memoria was already far out of reach, rendezvousing with the rear fleet, poised to strike at their true target.

name: Impeachment
window: At the end of the strategy phase
text: If the "Politics" strategy card is in another player's play area, take it and give that player 1 of your other strategy cards; otherwise, gain the speaker token.
flavorText: Elder Junn had seen many ruling parties come and go during his long years. This one, he knew, would be gone in the blink of an eye. He'd make sure of it.

name: Mechanized Workforce
window: Action
text: Remove 1 or more of your mechs from the game board; gain trade goods equal to the combined cost of those mechs.
flavorText: Another jolt from the machine surged through Rin's limbs. It no longer bothered her. She was changing. Not just mentally, but physically as well.

name: Fire for Effect
window: At the end of a round of space combat
text: Your units in the active system use their SPACE CANNON abilities against your opponent's ships.
flavorText: Trrakan had stockpiled munitions for this moment. If the reports were correct, and their forces were able to stave off the invasion for long enough, the enemy would find themselves under near continuous fire.

name: Shock Troops
window: At the start of the first round of a ground combat
text: Roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your participating ground forces. For each result equal to or greater than that unit's combat value, produce 1 hit against your opponent's units; on a result of 9 or 10, produce 1 additional hit.
flavorText: The fury and majesty of G'hom Sek'kus and her Valkyrie broke the enemy. It was clear they were no match for such reckless hate.

name: Seized Facility
window: When you gain control of a planet that contains another player's structure
text: Gain a non-faction technology owned by that player.
flavorText: PROTOCOL NOT FOUND >> [VAR:35782] RESISTANCE IS FUTILE << [NULL ID] DEFENSELESS >> ALL DATA << BELONGS TO US

name: Grand Operation
window: Action
text: Choose 1 system that does not contain other players' units. Move 1 or more of your ships in adjacent systems that do not contain 1 of your command tokens into the chosen system. [Note: You can transport ground forces during this movement.]
flavorText: "Frankly, sir, this operation is..." The Admiral trailed off. Alastair leaned back in his chair as he finished for her, "A logistical nightmare? I recommend you get to it then."

name: Continuous Barrage
window: At the end of a round of space combat
text: Your units in the active system use their ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE abilities against your opponent's units. [Note: This AFB still only targets fighters.]
flavorText: Mirik pounded his fist on his command chair. "We've locked onto the squadron's rendezvous point. Fire! Fire until not but dust remains!"

name: Border Skirmish
window: Action
text: Choose 2 adjacent systems that each contain a different player's ships. Each of those players roll 1 die for each of their ships in those systems; for each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, they produce 1 hit against the other player's ships in those systems.
flavorText: Airo Shir Aur interrupted the diplomat with a wave of his hand, "Our dominion knows no border." The man hesitated, then agreed.

name: Illusory Duplication
window: At the start of a space combat
text: Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that do not have SUSTAIN DAMAGE gain SUSTAIN DAMAGE until the end of this combat round.
flavorText: "What's wrong with these blasted sensors?" The Count slapped his data console, and, with that, it displayed the enemy ship's signature in a thirteenth different location.

name: Custodian Support
window: Action
text: Pass. Then, you may immediately score 1 of your unscored secret objectives if you fulfill its requirements and you were the first player to pass during this game round; otherwise, gain 2 commodities. [Note: You cannot play this card if you would not otherwise be eligible to pass.]
flavorText: The Custodians' proclamation mired Elder Qanoj in anxiety. More support for his enemies, disguised under the pretense of tradition.

name: Corruption
window: After the speaker reveals a public objective
text: Look at the top 2 cards of the corresponding public objective deck; you may reveal 1 of these cards and purge the objective the speaker revealed.
flavorText: Just as the charges went public, over half of the Council's Winnaran staff were arrested. The Winnu, meanwhile, secreted the true loyalist off of Mecatol and delivered their reward.

name: Corruption
window: Action
text: Pass. Then, you may immediately score 1 of your unscored secret objectives if you fulfill its requirements and you were the first player to pass during this game round; otherwise, draw 2 action cards. [Note: You cannot play this card if you would not otherwise be eligible to pass.]
flavorText: Just as the charges went public, over half of the Council's Winnaran staff were arrested. The Winnu, meanwhile, secreted the true loyalist off of Mecatol and delivered their reward.

name: Terraforming Initiative
window: Action
text: Ready 1 or 2 hazardous planets that any players control.
flavorText: Captain Agerro sighed. The work was not what he had expected, not what he had wanted, but it had to be done. Fighting would come later.

name: Political Upheaval
window: At the start of the strategy phase
text: During this strategy phase, strategy card choices start with the speaker and proceed counterclockwise.
flavorText: In the distance, a huge explosion illuminated the sky. Brother Milor gripped the rails of his balcony as he watched the chaos unfolding in the streets below. The people demanded a revolution, and he would grant them one.

name: Foreign Policy
window: Action
text: Reveal a number of action cards from the action card deck equal to the number of players. Give 1 of those action cards to each other player and take the remaining card.
flavorText: "Alone, we're vulnerable to looming threats," Odlynn projected dire scenes as he spoke, then pivoted to their reconstruction efforts. "United, we're unstoppable."

name: Recusal
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: During this agenda, voting begins with the player to your left and continues clockwise.
flavorText: Elder Junn had seen many ruling parties come and go during his long years. This one, he knew, would be gone in the blink of an eye. He'd make sure of it.

name: Collaboration
window: After another player performs an action
text: That player must perform an additional action this turn or pass.
flavorText: Mathis pursed his lips with disdain, "You will see to our agreements with the correct expedience." When Ssruu did not respond, his anger broke through, "Perhaps our massive fleets could provide you with motivation, should you continue to test us!"

name: Kickbacks
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each other player that did not vote for that outcome must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
flavorText: Gil was an emissary to the Civita Planetar. His career had made him well-connected, with comrades in hundreds of bureaucracies and favors owed in many more.

name: Singularity Charge
window: After the "Move Ships" step in a system that contains your units
text: Choose up to 2 units in that system. Those units lose their unit abilities during this tactical action.
flavorText: Ba'al watched as, one by one, each of the settlements went offline. He was not some fool to be laughed at. Who was laughing now?

name: Forced Hand
window: After another player performs an action
text: That player must perform an additional action this turn or pass.
flavorText: The past flooded Ahk-Syl Siven's thoughts upon seeing the Mahact, and the memory of his essence being rewritten on a subatomic level surged involuntarily to the forefront of his consciousness.

name: Escape Route
window: At the start of the "Announce Retreats" step
text: During this combat, you treat each system that contains 1 of your space docks as adjacent to this system when you announce or resolve a retreat. If you announce a retreat, you may reroll any die your opponent rolls.
flavorText: These were ancient routes, forgotten by time and kept secret by the Argent for use during their migration protocols.

name: Heist
window: After you gain control of a planet that was controlled by another player
text: Choose 1 type of relic fragment. That player must give you each relic fragment of that type in their play area.
flavorText: Mot awoke in a pool of his own blood. He was no longer bound – S'Ula had granted him that courtesy at least – but he was too weak to stand. So, he laid in front of the empty vault and wept.

name: Tributes
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 planet you control to gain trade goods equal to the combined value of its resources and influence.
flavorText: Berekar excelled at leveraging prestige to attain economic goals. The worlds governed by his people had become lavishly rich through tourism, fueled by their impressive collection of Lazax artifacts.

name: Proxy War
window: At the start of your turn
text: During this turn, until you activate another player's home system, players treat all promissory notes as blank.
flavorText: The sensors of the lead ship exploded with an array of alarms and damage alerts as an entire fleet of unmarked ships poured forth from the wormhole, raining destruction upon the unsuspecting convoy. Reports be damned, these were no mere pirates.

name: Unexpected Strategy
window: When you choose a strategy card
text: Gain 1 command token. Then, gain a number of additional command tokens equal to the number of trade goods on that strategy card.
flavorText: Despite their best syllogisms and heuristics, they could not discern whether the Creuss operated based on reason or some strange mechanism of cause and effect.

name: Electromagnetic Pulse
window: After the "Move Ships" step in a system that contains your units
text: Choose up to 2 units in that system. Those units lose their unit abilities during this tactical action.
flavorText: Ba'al watched as, one by one, each of the settlements went offline. He was not some fool to be laughed at. Who was laughing now?

name: Data Archive
window: Before the "Ready Planets" step of the agenda phase
text: Exhaust each of your readied planets to explore up to 2 of those planets.
flavorText: Xuange was practically beaming with pleasure, though none would ever know it. Their research had paid off—the vault was exactly where they had expected it to be.

name: Close Quarters
window: At the start of a combat
text: During this combat, apply +3 to the result of your unit's combat rolls and your opponent's unit's combat rolls.
flavorText: "Now, now, Unlenn," Evelyn smirked as she hailed the Viscount's heavy cruiser. "Looking to bring history to life, are we?" She gave the signal and the Benthic's railguns whirred to life.

name: Concise Legal Text
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Ready up to 3 planets you control. Until the "Resolve Outcome" step, players cannot resolve abilities.
flavorText: Magmus chuckled at Elder Junn's look of concern. "Let's see you worm your way out of this..."

name: Brilliant Tactician
window: At the start of your turn
text: Redistribute any number of your command tokens on your command sheet or place 1 command token from your reinforcements in your tactic pool.
flavorText: Unlenn massaged his brow and shut off his holoscreen. Even he had his limits. The magnum opus Lazax war theory at his fingertips, and yet... it was the single most boring piece of literature he'd ever had the displeasure to read.

name: Double Agents
window: When a non-active player plays an action card other than "Sabotage"
text: Cancel and take that action card.
flavorText: "Sorry, love, it's just business," Mot said with a hint of regret. S'Ula screamed from behind her gag as she watched him reroute the ship towards Arcturus.

name: Safety Overrides
window: After 1 of your mechs is destroyed during a ground combat
text: Choose up to 3 of your opponent's ground forces. Roll 1 die for each of those units; on a result of 6 or greater, produce 1 hit and assign it to that unit.
flavorText: In these white-hot flames, the Gashlai knew only ecstasy.

name: Crisis Management
window: After you pass
text: Perform the secondary ability of 1 readied or unchosen strategy card; if that strategy card is readied, do not spend or place a command token to resolve that ability.
flavorText: "Their greed blinds them. With every imaginable incarnation of death at our doorsteps, they still reach for more," Rinn sighed. "We must remain focused. Steady."

name: Averted Crisis
window: After you pass
text: Perform the secondary ability of 1 readied or unchosen strategy card; if that strategy card is readied, do not spend or place a command token to resolve that ability.
flavorText: "Their greed blinds them. With every imaginable incarnation of death at our doorsteps, they still reach for more," Rinn sighed. "We must remain focused. Steady."

name: Technological Breakthrough
window: When or after you research a technology
text: Ready each of your planets that have a technology specialty.
flavorText: The conference erupted in cheers as Doctor Sucaban announced his findings. Despite the countless sacrifices to reach these results, the wide range of applications made it difficult to feel regret.

name: Demoralization
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player that voted for that outcome destroys 3 of their infantry on the game board.
flavorText: The past flooded Ahk-Syl Siven's thoughts upon seeing the Mahact, and the memory of his essence being rewritten on a subatomic level surged involuntarily to the forefront of his consciousness.

name: Derelict Station
window: After your ships move out of, into, or through a system that does not contain a planet
text: Explore a frontier token that is in that system or gain 2 trade goods.
flavorText: The inhabitants of this forlorn place had long forgotten civilization. Their caches, however, bespoke what they once were.

name: Drop Pods
window: After your units use BOMBARDMENT against a planet
text: Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet for each die result that did not produce a hit.
flavorText: The brood swarmed around the planet, a tendril-like formation made entirely of ships. It whipped furiously as it released thousands of kin towards the surface, seeding the planet. It would be the home of a new generation of warriors.

name: Risky Jump
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +2 to the move value of 1 of your ships during this tactical action. When that ship moves into the active system, roll 1 die; on a result of 1 or 2, remove that ship from the game board, along with any units it is transporting.
flavorText: They were alive and ahead of schedule, but Mendosa had no intention of allowing his pilot to "eyeball it" ever again.

name: Reinforcements
window: After 1 of your non-fighter ships is destroyed during a space combat
text: Place 3 fighters in the active system.
flavorText: Many researchers have questioned why the Naalu's prescience did not lead them toward a path of excessive caution. Ta Zern postulated that it was linked to their excessive confidence.

name: Tributes
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex to gain trade goods equal to the combined value of its resources and influence.
flavorText: Berekar excelled at leveraging prestige to attain economic goals. The worlds governed by his people had become lavishly rich through tourism, fueled by their impressive collection of Lazax artifacts.

name: Boarding Torpedoes
window: When a hit is assigned to your opponent's non-fighter ship that has a cost of 4 or less
text: Replace that ship with a matching ship from your reinforcements. [Note: SUSTAIN DAMAGE is before the assignment of hits. If the unit is a ground force or structure that the other player is treating as a ship, you cannot place that unit.]
flavorText: "Brother," the officer cried, "our ships are breaking up! If we retreat now..." Milor glared at him. "No! Launch the remaining fighters and board the enemy in the lifepods. In Darien's name, we fight to the last!"

name: Side Project
window: Action
text: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to research a technology that has no prerequisites.
flavorText: As the council meeting drew to a close, Suffi stood up. "Before we adjourn, I'd like to announce that our neural enhancement project has entered the final phase of clinical trials."

name: Defense Installation
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 planet you control to place 1 PDS from your reinforcements on that planet.
flavorText: Tellurian had heard rumors of their kind roaming to the far corners of the galaxy. However, many such tales had led them to nothing more than decrepit defense systems. Alas, no stone could be left unturned.

name: Meteor Pods
window: After you commit a ground force to land on another player's planet
text: Roll 2 dice. For each result equal to or greater than that unit's combat value, produce 1 hit against that player's ground forces on that planet.
flavorText: A tendril-like formation of ships swarmed around the planet. It whipped furiously as they seeded the surface with brood.

name: Diverse Strategies
window: When you would perform the primary ability of your strategy card
text: Perform the secondary ability of that strategy card and 1 other instead; do not spend or place command tokens to resolve these abilities.
flavorText: "We will win this war, Rickar, based on how we adapt to it," Claire said sternly. "Humanity has honed its differences into strength. Your people must do the same."

name: Advantageous Position
window: After another player makes a combat or unit ability roll against your units
text: That player rerolls all of their dice.
flavorText: Unlenn sat on the edge of a knife, his ship groaning against the rift's horizon. His crew clung to their stations, eyes wide, as the enemy's munitions vanished into the void like pebbles dropped into a well.

name: Liberation
window: After you gain control of a planet
text: Place 3 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.
flavorText: Harsh penal colonies were all too common, always filled with hardy folk eager for a chance at revenge.

name: Last Minute Deliberation
window: Before the "Ready Planets" step of the agenda phase
text: Ready up to 3 planets you control. Then, reveal the top card of the agenda deck; players vote on this agenda.
flavorText: The rules for such an occasion were dubious. However, dubious had always been Elder Junn's specialty.

name: Promissory Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each other player that did not vote for that outcome must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
flavorText: Gil's career at the Civita Planetar was prolific, with friends in hundreds of bureaucracies and favors owed in many more.

name: Military Treatise
window: At the start of your turn
text: Either redistribute your command tokens or place 1 command token from your reinforcements in your fleet pool.
flavorText: Unlenn massaged his brow and shut off his holoscreen. The magnum opus on Lazax war theory at his fingertips, and yet... it was the most boring piece of literature he'd ever had the displeasure to read.

name: Annexation
window: After you commit units to land on another player's non-legendary, non-home planet other than Mecatol Rex
text: That player must remove each of their units from that planet and place them on any other planets they control, if able.
flavorText: Airo Shir Aur interrupted the diplomat with a wave of their hand. "Our dominion knows no border."

name: Sister Ship
window: After 1 of your non-fighter ships is destroyed
text: Produce 1 ship of that type in a different system that contains 1 of your units with PRODUCTION; reduce the cost of that ship by up to 4.
flavorText: The production of the Van Hauge VI was completed in record time. As it left the docking bay, Dannel smiled—a rare occurrence these days. "Glory to the Yin, my brothers. You have done us all proud."

name: Blackmail
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Choose another player. That player may give you 1 random promissory note from their hand; otherwise, they must cast at least 1 vote for an outcome of your choice during this agenda, if able.
flavorText: Dirzuga Ohao stood next to the leader of the revolutionaries, his pale eyes full of accusation. "Not every secret is lost in death, Brother Milor," they said in unison.

name: Energy Pulse
window: After the "Move Ships" substep of a tactical action in a system that contains your units
text: Choose 1 non-flagship unit in that system. That unit loses its printed abilities during this tactical action.
flavorText: Ba'al watched as, one by one, each of the settlements went offline. He was not some fool to be laughed at. Who was laughing now?

name: Smuggler Routes
window: Action
text: Move 1 of your ships to an adjacent system that does not contain other players' units; ignore the effects of anomalies during this action. [Note: You can transport units during this movement.]
flavorText: Greg closed his book, a tale of the Passage of Tears, with a sigh. As he looked to the sky and imagined the space beyond—a place he had never been—he quietly sang in tune with the Symphony, "I wanna be where the Mentak are. I wanna see—wanna see 'em raidin'."

name: Spatial Collapse
window: Action
text: Swap the positions of 2 adjacent, non-home systems, other than the Mecatol Rex system and the Wormhole Nexus; one of the chosen systems must contain your ships.
flavorText: The reports were so incredible that Rin demanded a firsthand view. Defying all she knew, the spatial dimension was a twisted mockery of itself, the nearby systems perfectly mirrored in position.

name: Anti-gravity Platforms
window: At the start of a ground combat
text: Choose 1 of your non-fighter ships in the active system. That ship participates in the "Roll Dice" step of this combat as if it were a ground force on the planet.
flavorText: The battle seemed to freeze as the J.N.S. Hylarim entered low orbit, its shadow eclipsing the conflict—and the hopes of its enemies.

name: Renegotiation
window: After another player resolves an effect of 1 of your promissory notes
text: Exhaust 1 planet that player controls and ready 1 planet you control.
flavorText: The Creuss merchants were overwhelmed by the bazaar's wares: wonders from every corner of the galaxy, akin to magic for these curious folk. Gila knew her claws had dug in. She would ensure their every desire was fulfilled, even if they could not afford the price.

name: Corruption
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each other player that voted for that outcome reveals 1 random action card from their hand; take 1 of those cards and discard the rest.
flavorText: As they placed the noose around her neck, Menda wailed. Suffi, who was next in line, gave her a confident smile. "First time?"

name: Early Voting
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Choose another player. That player votes first on this agenda. If you and that player cast votes for the same outcome of this agenda, cast 5 additional votes for that outcome. [Note: This ability works like Argent Zeal. Argent votes before the chosen player.]
flavorText: Ciel slowly covered his mouth in horror as he realized his mistake. "Damn these galactic time zones!"

name: Discord
window: When a player performs a strategic action
text: Choose 1 player. If that player spends a command token during this strategic action, they must spend 1 additional token from their command sheet, if able.
flavorText: Spittle flew forth from The Stillness's crimson maw as a gurgled laugh escaped it. Their human minions had done well.

name: Continuous Barrage
window: At the start of the second round of a space combat
text: You perform the "Anti-Fighter Barrage" step during this combat round as if it were the first round of combat.
flavorText: Mirik pounded his fist on his command chair. "We've locked onto the squadron's rendezvous point. Fire with precision!"

name: Rendezvous Point
window: After the "Movement" step of your tactical action in a system that does not contain another player's units
text: Remove your command token from that system and end your turn.
flavorText: "Frankly, sir, this operation is..." The Admiral trailed off. Alastair leaned back in his chair and finished her sentence, "A logistical nightmare? I recommend you get to it then."

name: Pivoted Plans
window: Action
text: Discard between 1 and 3 action cards from your hand to draw an equal number of action cards.
flavorText: "We must not become stagnant. Stagnation is what broke this galaxy," I48S said, barely hesitating at his patient's screams. "Pain? Let's remove that."

name: Virulent Gas
window: After you produce a hit against units on a planet
text: Produce 1 additional hit. Then, roll 1 die; on a result of 7-10, apply -1 to the result of each of your die rolls during this ability and repeat its effect.
flavorText: As they cut through the ancient structure's wall, Dart's laser-cutter illuminated a canister close to the beam. Tai squealed, "E-e-exterrix gas!"—and Dart ran.

name: Public Outcry
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each other player that voted for that outcome reveals 1 random action card from their hand; take 1 of those cards and discard the rest.
flavorText: As they placed the noose around her neck, Menda wailed. Suffi, who was next in line, gave her a confident smile. "First time?"
